original: don rang gi ngo bos snang ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dmigs pa med kyang mi slu pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don rang gi ngo bos snang ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dmigs pa med kyang mi slu pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Even though inference is without an objective support, it is non-deceptive because the object appears by way of its own nature. Thus, inference is taught to be a valid cognition:

original: de tshad ma nyid yin pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de tshad ma nyid yin pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is a valid cognition.

original: yang dag pa nyid 'di yin yang //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid 'di yin yang //
translated: This is the truth.

original: rnam pa dag khyod mi 'dod pa //
analyzed: rnam pa dag khyod mi 'dod pa //
translated: But you do not accept the aspects.

original: zhes bya ba 'di bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di bsal ba yin no //
translated: This is what is being refuted.

original: de dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na de bzhin du gzhan yang yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa mtshungs pas thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid dam yang na 'di yang yin no zhes zer ba la gal te rmi lam dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na de bzhin du gzhan yang yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa mtshungs pas thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid dam yang na 'di yang yin no zhes zer ba la gal te rmi lam dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it has an objective support, then it is reasonable that all other [cognitions] are also like that. Thus, all [cognitions] have objective supports, or else this [inference] also does not [have an objective support].

original: de la dmigs pa nyid yin na yang ji ltar tha dad pa 'grub pa yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa nyid yin na yang ji ltar tha dad pa 'grub pa yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: If it has an objective support, then how is the establishment of difference?

original: de gnyis tha dad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis tha dad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In that regard, if they are different, etc.

original: mi bslu ba can gyi nges pa tha dad pa'i sgrub byed ni mi snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi bslu ba can gyi nges pa tha dad pa'i sgrub byed ni mi snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no proof of a different kind of certainty that is not deceptive.

original: 'di zhes zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa nyid du sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa nyid du sems pa'o //
translated: The word this refers to the idea of sameness.

original: don dam par mi mthun pa nyid med pa kho na dpe la dpe can gyi'o zhes bstan pa ni de nas phyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: don dam par mi mthun pa nyid med pa kho na dpe la dpe can gyi'o zhes bstan pa ni de nas phyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The example is not different in the ultimate sense. This is what is being taught.

original: sngar snang ba'i khyad par las ma yin gyi 'jig rten las yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngar snang ba'i khyad par las ma yin gyi 'jig rten las yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not from the previously mentioned distinction in appearance, but from the world.

original: 'jig rten la grags pa tha dad pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags pa tha dad pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The inference that follows the worldly consensus is taught.

original: gal te nyes pa yod na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te nyes pa yod na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is a fault, it says.

original: don dam par grub pa ni rjes su dpag pa 'jugs pa la gnod pa yin par bstan pa ni /🔽gal te tshad ma med pa na //
analyzed: don dam par grub pa ni rjes su dpag pa 'jugs pa la gnod pa yin par bstan pa ni / gal te tshad ma med pa na //
translated: The ultimate establishment is taught to be a hindrance to the engagement of inference.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is no valid cognition, it says.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te tshad ma ma yin na zhes bya ba'am rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te tshad ma ma yin na zhes bya ba'am rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: If it were not so, it says, if it were not a valid cognition, or if it were not a Vedic injunction.

original: 'di nyid 'jig rten la grags pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid 'jig rten la grags pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: This is the same as what is accepted in the world.

original: de lta na 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is so, then, etc.

original: phyi ma don dam pas lnga ma 'jig rten la grub pa la gnod na thams cad rjes su dpag pa nyid du mi 'byung bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phyi ma don dam pas lnga ma 'jig rten la grub pa la gnod na thams cad rjes su dpag pa nyid du mi 'byung bar bstan pa ni /
translated: If the latter, which is ultimate, contradicts the five, which are established in the world, then it is shown that nothing would occur as inference.

original: chos can thun mong ba @131a * //
analyzed: chos can thun mong ba @131a * //
translated: The common subject

original: nyid du // rtogs pa gang yin tshad ma min //
analyzed: nyid du // rtogs pa gang yin tshad ma min //
translated: is not a valid cognition.

original: de ltar yin dang de lta bu'i //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang de lta bu'i //
translated: If it were so, then such

original: sgo can phyi rol gzhan yang min //
analyzed: sgo can phyi rol gzhan yang min //
translated: would not be external, nor would it have another door.

original: zhes bya ba la de'i phyir gzhan yang min pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin yang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de'i phyir gzhan yang min pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin yang ngo //
translated: Nor would it be external, nor would it have another door, even though it is inference.

original: de lta bu'i sgo can tshad ma ma yin pa'i chos can rtogs pa'i sgo can ni tshad ma min zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sgo can tshad ma ma yin pa'i chos can rtogs pa'i sgo can ni tshad ma min zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: That which has such a door is not a valid cognition, and that which has a door for understanding a subject that is not a valid cognition is not a valid cognition.

original: tha mi dad pa bsgrub pa ni /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa bsgrub pa ni /
translated: The proof of non-difference

original: dpe la sogs pa'i tha dad pa dang 'gal ba can yin gyi 'phel ba la ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: dpe la sogs pa'i tha dad pa dang 'gal ba can yin gyi 'phel ba la ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: is contradictory to the difference of example, etc., but not to increase.

original: gal te de'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were so, etc.

original: 'di la yang tshad ma dang cig shos nyid thun mong ba dang thun mog ma yin pa'i tshad ma nyid dang 'gal ba nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la yang tshad ma dang cig shos nyid thun mong ba dang thun mog ma yin pa'i tshad ma nyid dang 'gal ba nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Here, it is shown that the valid cognition and the other are contradictory in being common and uncommon.

original: rang bzhin tshad ma nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin tshad ma nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is called “the valid cognition of the nature.”

original: de la ni chos can la'o //
analyzed: de la ni chos can la'o //
translated: There, it is with regard to the subject.

original: de dang bral ba ni zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya bzhin pa nyid kyi khyad par dang bral ba ni spyis 'dzin pa yin gyi tshad ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya bzhin pa nyid kyi khyad par dang bral ba ni spyis 'dzin pa yin gyi tshad ma ni ma yin no //
translated: “Free from that” means that the apprehension of the universal is free from the particular that is being proven, but it is not a valid cognition.

original: de las bzlog par 'dzin pa na zhes bya ba ni khyad par las bzlog par 'dzin pa la'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog par 'dzin pa na zhes bya ba ni khyad par las bzlog par 'dzin pa la'o //
translated: “When apprehending the opposite of that” means when apprehending the opposite of the particular.

original: de las bzlog pa'i gzhan bya drungs phyung na zhes bya ba ni khyad par las bzlog pa'i gzhan bya drungs phyung na ste gnod pa na'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i gzhan bya drungs phyung na zhes bya ba ni khyad par las bzlog pa'i gzhan bya drungs phyung na ste gnod pa na'o //
translated: “When the opposite of that is uprooted” means when the opposite of the particular is uprooted, that is, when it is refuted.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis te snga mas ma bzung ba ni snga nas yod pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis te snga mas ma bzung ba ni snga nas yod pa'o //
translated: “By its own nature” means that which was not apprehended before exists from before.

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni spyi'i cha'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni spyi'i cha'o //
translated: “Some” means a part of the universal.

original: spyi'i dang khyad par dag gi dbye ba yin na gzhan dang gcig tu 'dzin pa ma yin par zer ba ni chos tha dad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi'i dang khyad par dag gi dbye ba yin na gzhan dang gcig tu 'dzin pa ma yin par zer ba ni chos tha dad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is a distinction between general and particular, it is not held to be the same as the other. This is what is meant by “different things.”

original: gzung ba'i spyi dang 'gal ba can ma yin pa'i khyad par sgrub par byed pa bzhin du sgro btags pa'i tha dad pa'i 'gal ba can yin la /
analyzed: gzung ba'i spyi dang 'gal ba can ma yin pa'i khyad par sgrub par byed pa bzhin du sgro btags pa'i tha dad pa'i 'gal ba can yin la /
translated: Just as a proof of a particular that is not contradictory to a generally perceived object is a superimposed difference,

original: tha mi dad par sgrub par byed pa 'gal ba can ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha mi dad par sgrub par byed pa 'gal ba can ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: a proof of non-difference is not contradictory. This is shown by

original: tha dad par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “if there were difference.”

original: rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of “distinction” is

original: chos can du byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos can du byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “as the subject.”

original: tha mi dad par rig pa rgyu dang 'gal ba yin na ji ltar 'bras bu tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha mi dad par rig pa rgyu dang 'gal ba yin na ji ltar 'bras bu tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If non-difference is known to be contradictory to the cause, how can it be a proof of a different effect? This is the meaning.

original: shes pa nyid dmigs pa dang bcas pa las gnod par byed pa mi dmigs pas bzlog pa ni dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni ji ltar rmi lam gyi shes pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: shes pa nyid dmigs pa dang bcas pa las gnod par byed pa mi dmigs pas bzlog pa ni dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni ji ltar rmi lam gyi shes pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The object of consciousness in a dream is not different from the consciousness itself, and the object of consciousness in the waking state is not different from the consciousness in a dream.

original: 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang gzhi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang gzhi mthun pa'o //
translated: The reply to this is: “Because it is not different from consciousness in a dream.”

original: de nyid dmigs pa med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa nyid las @131b rnam par grol ba nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid dmigs pa med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa nyid las @131b rnam par grol ba nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The object of consciousness in a dream is not different from the consciousness itself, and the object of consciousness in the waking state is not different from the consciousness in a dream.

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The reply to this is: “Because it is not different from consciousness in a dream.”🔽The meaning of this is as follows: The object of consciousness in a dream is not different from the consciousness itself, and the object of consciousness in the waking state is not different from the consciousness in a dream.🔽The reply to this is: “Because it is not different from consciousness in a dream.”🔽The meaning of this is as follows: The object of consciousness in a dream is not different from the consciousness itself, and the object of consciousness in the waking state is not different from the consciousness in a dream.

original: nus pa mi mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba'o //🔽gzhan pa'i skyes bu gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: nus pa mi mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba'o // gzhan pa'i skyes bu gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The reply to this is: “Because it is not different from consciousness in a dream.”🔽The meaning of this is as follows: The object of consciousness in a dream is not different from the consciousness itself, and the object of consciousness in the waking state is not different from the consciousness in a dream.🔽The reply to this is: “Because it is not different from consciousness in a dream.”

original: dmigs bzhin pa nyid dmigs pa yin par rmi lam la yang yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa mtshungs pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs bzhin pa nyid dmigs pa yin par rmi lam la yang yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa mtshungs pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The object of consciousness in a dream is not different from the consciousness itself, and the object of consciousness in the waking state is not different from the consciousness in a dream.🔽The reply to this is: “Because it is not different from consciousness in a

original: de la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “That” refers to the dream.

original: thams cad kyi tshe med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni du ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni du ba'o //
translated: “It would not exist at all” refers to the smoke.

original: king shu ka'i phung po ni du ba mi byed kyang rang gi bya ba byed pas yod pa kho na yin gyi rmi lam gyi mtha' can ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: king shu ka'i phung po ni du ba mi byed kyang rang gi bya ba byed pas yod pa kho na yin gyi rmi lam gyi mtha' can ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: “Just as a pile of kaṭhina wood, although not producing smoke, still exists because it performs its own function, and is not like something at the end of a dream.”

original: king shu ka'i phung po bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: king shu ka'i phung po bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Like a pile of kaṭhina wood” refers to this.

original: rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: “In that way” refers to the supramundane.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du rig pa tsam don yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du rig pa tsam don yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Consciousness itself” refers to the mere awareness that is the object, because it is the meaning.

original: rig pa tsam gyi don can gyi bde ba la sogs pa yang phyi rol gyi don can gyi don yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: rig pa tsam gyi don can gyi bde ba la sogs pa yang phyi rol gyi don can gyi don yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: “The meaning of mere awareness is the object, and the object is external.”

original: don gyi rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: “The nature of the object” refers to this.

original: goms pa'i stobs kyis byung ba nyid ni /
analyzed: goms pa'i stobs kyis byung ba nyid ni /
translated: “Arises from the power of habituation” refers to this.

original: phyi rol gyi nye bar len pa can gyi mig la sogs pa la yang yod pas rang gi rtogs pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi nye bar len pa can gyi mig la sogs pa la yang yod pas rang gi rtogs pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the eyes, etc. which are external appropriators also exist, it is a special understanding of one's own.

original: rang gi rtogs pa nyid don nyid la 'gal ba'i 'bras bu yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi rtogs pa nyid don nyid la 'gal ba'i 'bras bu yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that the very understanding of one's own is the effect of the contradiction of the object itself is:

original: ma yin te nang gi byed pa la rag las par zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma yin te nang gi byed pa la rag las par zhes bya ba ste /
translated: No, it is dependent on the internal agent.

original: shes pa'i byed pa la ngag las pa nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i byed pa la ngag las pa nyid kyi'o //
translated: It is the activity of consciousness, the activity of speech.

original: sad pa la yang thams cad de la rag las pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sad pa la yang thams cad de la rag las pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that even in the waking state, everything is dependent on that is:

original: de ltar yang blo tsam du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang blo tsam du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, in mere awareness.

original: rig pa la ni don gzhan nyid khyad par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rig pa la ni don gzhan nyid khyad par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that it is contradictory for a different object to be the modifier of awareness is:

original: rang bzhin de ni zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: rang bzhin de ni zhes bya ba'o//
translated: That nature.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni 'khrul par 'dod pa'i shes pa'i don yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni 'khrul par 'dod pa'i shes pa'i don yang ngo //
translated: Similarly, and so on refers to the object of consciousness that is asserted to be mistaken.

original: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa yod na gzhan gyi shes pa la yang srid do zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa yod na gzhan gyi shes pa la yang srid do zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Similarly, it is said that if the eyes, etc. exist, it is possible in the consciousness of another.

original: 'on te pha rol dag gis kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te pha rol dag gis kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, rather, by others as well.

original: goms pa'i khyad par las 'chol ba dang cig shos la sogs pa'i khyad par yin gyi /
analyzed: goms pa'i khyad par las 'chol ba dang cig shos la sogs pa'i khyad par yin gyi /
translated: The difference between the confused and the non-confused, etc., is due to the difference in the degree of practice,

original: don yod pa dang cig shos las ma yin pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don yod pa dang cig shos las ma yin pa bstan pa ni /
translated: and not due to the existence or non-existence of the object.

original: goms pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: goms pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said: by the difference in the degree of practice.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
translated: Therefore, means by direct perception.

original: rang nyid las tshad ma ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa la 'brel pa las tshad ma nyid ni rtog pa gzhan gyi go bya yin te /🔽'brel pa @132a * //
analyzed: rang nyid las tshad ma ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa la 'brel pa las tshad ma nyid ni rtog pa gzhan gyi go bya yin te / 'brel pa @132a * //
translated: The non-valid cognition is not valid by itself, but by the relation to the other conceptual cognition.🔽The relation is not from another itself,

original: gzhan nyid las yin pa ni thug pa med pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan nyid las yin pa ni thug pa med pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: and this is shown to be an infinite regress.

original: 'di las yang phyogs nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di las yang phyogs nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the same as the position.

original: rnam shes phyi rol gyi bskyed bya yin par zer na bag chags kyi bskyed bya yin par gnyi ga la grub pa'i phyir khas blang bar 'os pa yin no zhes de dag tsam brjod bya yin gyi bsgrub bya ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /🔽phyi dang rgyu 'bras zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam shes phyi rol gyi bskyed bya yin par zer na bag chags kyi bskyed bya yin par gnyi ga la grub pa'i phyir khas blang bar 'os pa yin no zhes de dag tsam brjod bya yin gyi bsgrub bya ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni / phyi dang rgyu 'bras zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is all that can be said; it is not a proof.

original: bag chags las skye ba nyid du ma grub kyang sngon po la sogs pa ni shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: bag chags las skye ba nyid du ma grub kyang sngon po la sogs pa ni shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: Even though it is not established that blue and so on arise from habitual propensities, they are consciousness,

original: bde ba bzhin du rang rig pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba bzhin du rang rig pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: because, like pleasure, they are self-cognizing.🔽This is stated in the line: “Even though they are not produced by habitual propensities.

original: bag chags kyis bskyed pa med kyang zhes bya ba'o //🔽sngon po ni rig pa'i dus tsam la yod pas de dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir sad pa na yang rmi lam dang mtshungs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bag chags kyis bskyed pa med kyang zhes bya ba'o // sngon po ni rig pa'i dus tsam la yod pas de dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir sad pa na yang rmi lam dang mtshungs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: although not produced by latent impressions.🔽Since blue exists at the time of cognition, they are not different. Therefore, even when awake, it is similar to a dream.🔽

original: de dang mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since blue and so on exist only at the time of their perception, they are not different from consciousness. Therefore, even when one is awake, things are like dreams. This is stated in the line: “Because they are similar to that.🔽”

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dus na 'brel pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dus na 'brel pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: At the time of inference, the relation is not grasped.

original: de'i phyir 'brel pa gzung ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'brel pa gzung ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the statement that the connection is apprehended is:

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dus na zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dus na zhes bya ba'o//
translated: “At the time of inference.”

original: bar du chod pa'i me'i bskyed bya du ba bzhin du bar du chod pa'i goms pa'i sad pa yin par bstan pa ni /🔽bsgom pa chod par gyur na yang //
analyzed: bar du chod pa'i me'i bskyed bya du ba bzhin du bar du chod pa'i goms pa'i sad pa yin par bstan pa ni / bsgom pa chod par gyur na yang //
translated: The statement that the waking state is the product of the practice that is interrupted is:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Even when the practice is interrupted.”

original: sad pa na mthong ba cung zad nyid ni de lta bu goms pa'i bskyed bya yin gyi /
analyzed: sad pa na mthong ba cung zad nyid ni de lta bu goms pa'i bskyed bya yin gyi /
translated: The statement that the slight seeing in the waking state is the product of the practice, but not the seeing at the very beginning of birth, is:

original: skye ba'i dang po la mthong ba yang ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: skye ba'i dang po la mthong ba yang ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: “The seeing at the very beginning of birth is not like that.”

original: de yang skye ba snga ma la goms pa dran pa nyid log pa'i de ma thag tu rmi lam mthong ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de yang skye ba snga ma la goms pa dran pa nyid log pa'i de ma thag tu rmi lam mthong ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that the seeing of dreams immediately after the cessation of the recollection of the practice in a previous life is the seeing of dreams is:

original: skye ba gzhan sogs mthong ba yang //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan sogs mthong ba yang // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The seeing of another birth, etc.”

original: 'chi ba'i gnyid ni gnyid log pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i gnyid ni gnyid log pa'o //
translated: The sleep of death is the sleep of the dying.

original: rmi lam ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: rmi lam ni mthong ba'o //
translated: The dream is the seeing.

original: don mthong ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba 'di la'o //
analyzed: don mthong ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba 'di la'o //
translated: The seeing of the object is in this life.

original: phyis kyi ni mtshan mo ni ma rig pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: phyis kyi ni mtshan mo ni ma rig pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: The night is the sign of nescience.

original: des chod pa ni bsgribs pa'o //
analyzed: des chod pa ni bsgribs pa'o //
translated: It is obscured by it.

original: nyin mo ni 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi sems tsam nyid gang gi yin pa de yang de yin la /
analyzed: nyin mo ni 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi sems tsam nyid gang gi yin pa de yang de yin la /
translated: The day is the mere mind which has the nature of light.

original: rmi lam bzhin du de kho na nyid 'jug pa med pas mthong ba'i tha snyad med pas 'jig rten pa yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam bzhin du de kho na nyid 'jug pa med pas mthong ba'i tha snyad med pas 'jig rten pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no engagement with reality as in a dream, there is no convention of seeing. Therefore, it is mundane.

original: rmi lam du mthong ba goms pa las byung ba nyid du bsgrub nas 'di las khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rmi lam du mthong ba goms pa las byung ba nyid du bsgrub nas 'di las khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: Having established that what is seen in a dream arises from the impressions of what is seen in the waking state, he says that there is no difference between the two.

original: gnyid kyi dus na 'byung ba nyid bsal ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyid kyi dus na 'byung ba nyid bsal ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not that what occurs in sleep is refuted.

original: goms pa'i khyad par las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: goms pa'i khyad par las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It arises from the impressions of what is seen in the waking state.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i'o //
translated: This also refers to the waking state.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du dam bcas pa ni mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du dam bcas pa ni mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: The thesis that it has an object is contradicted by perception.

original: sgra ni mnyan @132b par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: sgra ni mnyan @132b par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: Sound is not audible.

original: gnod par byed pa'i shes pa ni //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i shes pa ni //
translated: The cognition that contradicts that

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is perception.

original: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rjes su dpag pa ni de dang 'gal bas tshad ma ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rjes su dpag pa ni de dang 'gal bas tshad ma ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: and that inference is not a means of valid knowledge because it is contradicted by perception.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba can ni mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba can ni mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But this is a thesis that the inference is not contradicted by perception, not that it is not contradicted by what precedes it.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum tsam dang 'gal ba can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum tsam dang 'gal ba can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that inference is not contradicted by mere perception.

original: khyed la yang bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dag phan tshun bsten pa dag ji ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: khyed la yang bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dag phan tshun bsten pa dag ji ltar ma yin te /
translated: And how is it that the probandum and the probans are not mutually dependent in your case?

original: mngon sum yin pa'i phyir dang // gzhan gyi bsgrub bya ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum yin pa'i phyir dang // gzhan gyi bsgrub bya ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because it is perception and because it is not the probandum of another.

original: 'di ni bshad zin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bshad zin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This has been explained already.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba myong ba nyid yin no zhes bstan pas de yang tshad ma nyid yin par tshad mas grub pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba myong ba nyid yin no zhes bstan pas de yang tshad ma nyid yin par tshad mas grub pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: And since it is taught that the future is experienced, it is taught that it is not established by a means of valid knowledge as a means of valid knowledge.

original: de yang thog ma med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang thog ma med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is also explained in the passage beginning with “It is beginningless.”

original: long ba brgyud pa las 'ongs pa ji ltar tshad ma nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: long ba brgyud pa las 'ongs pa ji ltar tshad ma nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How can a cognition that is transmitted through a series of blind people be valid?

original: mi slu ba las yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mi slu ba las yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: To show that it is nondeceptive, he says:

original: de yang mi slu ba las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang mi slu ba las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is also nondeceptive.

original: lhag par zhen par bya ba dang phrad pa'i tshad ma nyid ni lhag par zhen pa dang phrad pa dag gi yul gcig nyid la tha snyad rtogs pa na /
analyzed: lhag par zhen par bya ba dang phrad pa'i tshad ma nyid ni lhag par zhen pa dang phrad pa dag gi yul gcig nyid la tha snyad rtogs pa na /
translated: The validity of a cognition that is engaged in the ascertainment of an object is the object itself, which is ascertained by the cognition that is engaged in ascertainment.

original: shes pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “it is a cognition” is that it is a cognition of that object.

original: rang gi ngo bo'i yul la zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba la'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i yul la zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba la'o //
translated: “ Its object” refers to an unclear object.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo la'o //
translated: “ It” refers to the nature of the cognition.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i'o //
translated: “ That” refers to the object of inference.

original: mngon sum nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi rig pa'i ngo bo'o //🔽gnod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi rig pa'i ngo bo'o // gnod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum la ni ma yin te /
translated: “ Direct perception” refers to the nature of reflexive awareness.🔽A subsequent cognition that is a refutation does not occur in relation to reflexive awareness, which is direct perception.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can nyid kyi yul mtshungs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba la des na /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can nyid kyi yul mtshungs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba la des na /
translated: Because it is an object that is hidden, it is not the same as the object of inference.

original: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The word “inferential” is added.

original: lkog tu gyur pa la yang yul mtshungs pa nyid ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa la yang yul mtshungs pa nyid ji ltar yin te /
translated: How can there be the same object in the case of the hidden?

original: mngon sum mi byed pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum mi byed pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Because it is not directly perceived.

original: ji ltar lkog tu gyur pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar lkog tu gyur pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is “How can there be the hidden?”🔽It is because of the engagement, not because of the apprehension.

original: 'jug par byed pa nyid kyis yin gyi 'dzin par byed pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa dang zhen pa dag med na 'jug par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir mi rigs so snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa nyid kyis yin gyi 'dzin par byed pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa dang zhen pa dag med na 'jug par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir mi rigs so snyam du sems pa la /
translated: The response to this is “If there is no apprehension and no adherence, there can be no engagement.”

original: 'di ltar tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba'o //🔽rjes su dpag pas gnod zhes bya ba ni nges pa tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba'o // rjes su dpag pas gnod zhes bya ba ni nges pa tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: The response to this is “Because of the difference.”🔽The response to this is “It is not contradicted by inference.”

original: mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //🔽de'i phyir rjes @133a * //
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no // de'i phyir rjes @133a * //
translated: It is not contradicted by mere certainty, because there is no apprehension and there is no relation.

original: su dpag pa ni 'dzin pas gtso bo ma yin te /
analyzed: su dpag pa ni 'dzin pas gtso bo ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, inference is not primary because of apprehension.

original: nges pa las zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa las zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that it is because of certainty.

original: de yang de med na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang de med na yang ma yin te /
translated: And that is not the case when there is no apprehension.

original: goms pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir de nyid nges pa'i so so pa'i thabs yin la /
analyzed: goms pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir de nyid nges pa'i so so pa'i thabs yin la /
translated: Because of the power of the habit of grasping, it is the method of the individual who is certain about that.

original: rjes su dpag pa la yang sngar 'jug pa'i nus pa las yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la yang sngar 'jug pa'i nus pa las yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And in the case of inference, it is from the power of the previous engagement.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni de med pa'i rjes su dpag pa mngon sum las byung bas gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni de med pa'i rjes su dpag pa mngon sum las byung bas gnod pa yin te /
translated: Inference about a hidden object is invalidated by the inference of its absence, which arises from perception.

original: rnam par rtog pa tsam las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tsam las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba la /
translated: Because it arises from mere conceptualization.

original: de ni long ba brgyud pa las byung ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni long ba brgyud pa las byung ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is like the story of the blind men examining an elephant.

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum las byung ba phyi rol med pa'i rjes su dpag pa ma dmigs pa gang yin pa ni rang rig pa gnyis las byung ba'i tha snyad pa de ni goms pa las mngon sum yang yin la /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum las byung ba phyi rol med pa'i rjes su dpag pa ma dmigs pa gang yin pa ni rang rig pa gnyis las byung ba'i tha snyad pa de ni goms pa las mngon sum yang yin la /
translated: The inference of the nonexistence of external things, which arises from the perception of reflexive awareness, is the conventional inference that arises from the two reflexive awarenesses. It is a direct perception that arises from habituation.

original: mngon sum rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
translated: Because direct perception is the root, it is taught that it is not invalidated.

original: mngon sum dang des bslang ba'i rjes su dpag pa dag la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang des bslang ba'i rjes su dpag pa dag la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The words direct perception and inference based on it are used.

original: phyi rol gyi rjes su dpag pa 'ba' zhig ni de med na gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rjes su dpag pa 'ba' zhig ni de med na gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: But if it is only an external inference, then it is not invalidated by the nonexistence of the external object, because it is a mistaken apprehension.

original: log par 'dzin pa'i phyir rang rig pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang zhes rgol ba sngon du 'gro bas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: log par 'dzin pa'i phyir rang rig pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang zhes rgol ba sngon du 'gro bas bstan pa ni /
translated: The words and inference of self-awareness are used to show that the opponent is arguing that if direct perception is not invalidated by the nonexistence of the external object, then inference is not invalidated by the nonexistence of the external object.🔽If inference is not invalidated by the nonexistence of the external object, then why is the external object not the object of inference?

original: gal te mngon sum yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The words then why is the external object not the object of inference? are used.🔽Therefore, because it is not the object of direct perception, etc., the external object is not the object of inference, etc. 🔽The words therefore, because it is not the object of direct perception, etc. are used.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir /🔽mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul yang phyir rol ma yin pa nyid du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir / mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul yang phyir rol ma yin pa nyid du gnas pa yin no //
translated: The words therefore, because it is not the object of direct perception, etc. are used.

original: de dgag byas pa de yin phyir //🔽de dag phyogs la gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: de dgag byas pa de yin phyir // de dag phyogs la gnod par 'gyur //
translated: The words therefore, because it is not the object of direct perception, etc. are used.

original: zhes zer ba mi rigs par bstan pa ni /🔽des na shes pa thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes zer ba mi rigs par bstan pa ni / des na shes pa thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The words therefore, because it is not the object of direct perception, etc. are used.🔽The words therefore, because it is not the object of direct perception, etc. are used.🔽The words therefore, because it is not the object of direct perception, etc. are used.🔽The words therefore, because it is not the object of direct perception, etc. are used.🔽The words therefore, because it is not the object of direct perception, etc. are used.🔽The words therefore, because it is not the object of direct perception, etc. are used.🔽The words therefore, because it is not the object of direct perception, etc. are used.🔽The words therefore, because it is not the object of direct perception, etc. are used.🔽The words therefore, because it is not the object of direct perception, etc. are used.🔽The words therefore, because it is not the object of direct perception, etc. are used.

original: de lta yin na dpe des zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i blo'i dpes so //
analyzed: de lta yin na dpe des zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i blo'i dpes so //
translated: The words therefore, because it is not the object of direct perception, etc. are used.

original: de rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa la dmigs pa yid kyis phyi rol ma yin pa nyid rig pa yin no //🔽de'i phyir / bslad pa'i shes pas gzung ba'i don //
analyzed: de rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa la dmigs pa yid kyis phyi rol ma yin pa nyid rig pa yin no // de'i phyir / bslad pa'i shes pas gzung ba'i don //
translated: The mind that observes what is not its own nature does not know what is external.🔽Therefore,🔽It is reasonable to refute the object

original: dgag par yang ni rigs pa yin //
analyzed: dgag par yang ni rigs pa yin //
translated: That is grasped by a mistaken consciousness.

original: bzung ba tsam la gnod byed na //
analyzed: bzung ba tsam la gnod byed na //
translated: If you refute mere grasping,

original: rang gi phyogs kyang 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs kyang 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: You will not establish your own position.

original: zhes bya ba ni legs par smras pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni legs par smras pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a good response.

original: dmigs pa med par de nyid du dmigs pa'i blo rnams kyi shes pa nyid dmigs pa med pa nyid du ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med par de nyid du dmigs pa'i blo rnams kyi shes pa nyid dmigs pa med pa nyid du ma nges pa yin te /
translated: The consciousnesses of minds that observe non-existence are not ascertained as non-existent.

original: de rnams dmigs bcas nyid yin na'ang //
analyzed: de rnams dmigs bcas nyid yin na'ang //
translated: Even if they are said to have objects,

original: de dag gis ni ma nges 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag gis ni ma nges 'gyur //
translated: They are not ascertained by them.

original: zhes zer ba ci gal te dmigs @133b pa med pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes zer ba ci gal te dmigs @133b pa med pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: What is the point of saying that they are non-existent?

original: sad pa'i blo dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na cig shos dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bzhin du 'di yang de ltar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sad pa'i blo dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na cig shos dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bzhin du 'di yang de ltar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If the minds of the waking state have objects, it follows that the minds of dreams also have objects.

original: rang gi cha la nges pa gnod par byed pa'i mngon sum gyis rjes su gzung ba'i shes pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang gi cha la nges pa gnod par byed pa'i mngon sum gyis rjes su gzung ba'i shes pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
translated: The cognition that is sustained by the direct perception that damages the ascertainment of its own part is itself the observed object.

original: gzhan yang de lta ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not like that.

original: thal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that it is too much:

original: gal te mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it is said that it is because it is preceded by direct perception,

original: thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i blo //
analyzed: thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i blo //
translated: then the cognition that establishes everything🔽would be a valid cognition.

original: gal te 'khrul 'dod de yi phyir //🔽ji ltar 'dod bzhin kun med pa'am //
analyzed: gal te 'khrul 'dod de yi phyir // ji ltar 'dod bzhin kun med pa'am //
translated: If it is asserted that it is mistaken, then🔽it would follow that everything does not exist as it is asserted,

original: ma tshang la sogs thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ma tshang la sogs thal bar 'gyur //
translated: or that it is incomplete, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: mngon sum gyis grub pa la yang 'di de tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis grub pa la yang 'di de tshad ma yin te /
translated: Even though it is established by direct perception, this is a valid cognition because

original: ltos pa med pa'i phyir zhes smra ba pos gzhan dag la smra ba ni de lta bu'i tha snyad yin pas tshad mar brjod pa des don sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i phyir zhes smra ba pos gzhan dag la smra ba ni de lta bu'i tha snyad yin pas tshad mar brjod pa des don sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: it is said that it is due to the absence of reliance. When the proponent speaks to others, it is a convention like that. Therefore, it is said that the statement of valid cognition establishes the object.

original: 'di tha dad pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di tha dad pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to that, it is said that it is different.

original: tha dad pa ni rang las so //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni rang las so //
translated: The difference is from itself.

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid kyi tha snyad la tshad mar tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid kyi tha snyad la tshad mar tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan pa ni /
translated: The reason for positing the valid cognition of the conventional in regard to the non-existence of the object is stated:

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “from another.”

original: tha snyad kyi ngo bo'i blo yang bdag cag gi ni yul la dmigs pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi ngo bo'i blo yang bdag cag gi ni yul la dmigs pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: The cognition of the nature of the conventional is also the perception of an object for us.

original: gal te de yi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de yi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is the nature of that,

original: kho bo cag gi yang mi bslu ba las de lta bu'i tha snyad yin gyi dmigs pa nyid las ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi yang mi bslu ba las de lta bu'i tha snyad yin gyi dmigs pa nyid las ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: it is taught that for us also the conventional is not deceptive, but not that it is a perception.

original: de la mi bslu ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la mi bslu ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “Because it is not deceptive in regard to that,”

original: ji ltar 'dod pa dang phrad pa ni mi bslu ba yin gyi dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa dang phrad pa ni mi bslu ba yin gyi dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that the attainment of the desired object is not deceptive, but not the perception.

original: dmigs pa med par yang de la dmigs pa can gyi blo yin la /
analyzed: dmigs pa med par yang de la dmigs pa can gyi blo yin la /
translated: Even without the object, there is a cognition that has that as its object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa'i rnam pa 'di la med do zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi rjes su dpag pa la dgos pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /🔽rig bya ba'i dngos po med pa kho nar zhes bya ba'o //🔽rig par bya ba med kyang rig par byed pa ni rig par byed pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni rig par byed pa lta bu'i rnam pa gang la yod pa de ni rig par byed pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa'i rnam pa 'di la med do zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi rjes su dpag pa la dgos pa ma yin par bstan pa ni / rig bya ba'i dngos po med pa kho nar zhes bya ba'o // rig par bya ba med kyang rig par byed pa ni rig par byed pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni rig par byed pa lta bu'i rnam pa gang la yod pa de ni rig par byed pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The statement “that which has the form of the means of knowledge is the form of the means of knowledge” is the teaching that the means of knowledge is the means of knowledge even without the object of knowledge.🔽If the means of knowledge does not exist, how can there be that which is similar to it?

original: rig par byed pa med na de dang 'dra ba ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: rig par byed pa med na de dang 'dra ba ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: The statement “due to error” is the teaching that the means of knowledge is the means of knowledge even without the object of knowledge.🔽The meaning of the statement “the object of knowledge is absolutely nonexistent” is that the means of knowledge is the means of knowledge even without the object of knowledge.🔽The statement “that which has the form of the means of knowledge is the form of the means of knowledge” is the teaching that the means of knowledge is the means of knowledge even without the object of knowledge.🔽The statement “due to error” is the teaching that the means of knowledge is the means of knowledge even without the object of knowledge.🔽The meaning of the statement “the object of knowledge is absolutely nonexistent” is that the means of knowledge is the means of knowledge even without the object of knowledge.🔽The statement “that which has the form of the means of knowledge is the form of the means of knowledge” is the teaching that the means of knowledge is the means of knowledge even without the object of knowledge.

original: 'khrul pas zhes bya ba ste /🔽thog ma med pa'i 'khrul pa bag chags kyis sgro btags pa'i rig par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khrul pas zhes bya ba ste / thog ma med pa'i 'khrul pa bag chags kyis sgro btags pa'i rig par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The statement “due to error” is the teaching that the means of knowledge is the means of knowledge even without the object of knowledge.🔽The meaning of the statement “the object of knowledge is absolutely nonexistent” is that the means of knowledge is the means of knowledge even without the object of knowledge.🔽The statement “that which has the form of the means of knowledge is the form of the means of knowledge” is the teaching that the means of knowledge is the means of knowledge even without the object of knowledge.🔽The statement “due to error” is the teaching that the means of knowledge is the means of knowledge even without the object of knowledge.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni de nyid la tshad ma yin ba'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni de nyid la tshad ma yin ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the statement “the object of knowledge is absolutely nonexistent” is that the means of knowledge is the means of knowledge even without the object of knowledge.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum la @134a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum la @134a * //
translated: The statement “that which has the

original: sogs pa'i yul phyi rol kho nar gnas pa yin /
analyzed: sogs pa'i yul phyi rol kho nar gnas pa yin /
translated: and so on, are located only in external objects.

original: de dgag byas pa de yi phyir //
analyzed: de dgag byas pa de yi phyir //
translated: Because of that refutation,

original: de dag phyogs la gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag phyogs la gnod par 'gyur //
translated: they are harmed in regard to their position.

original: 'on te 'di ni shes pa'am //
analyzed: 'on te 'di ni shes pa'am //
translated: Or else, if consciousness,

original: las dang yod pa sogs yod 'gyur //
analyzed: las dang yod pa sogs yod 'gyur //
translated: action, existence, and so on, exist,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The following is stated to demonstrate the refutation of that:

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ste dngos su ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ste dngos su ba'o //
translated: “If there is an object, then there is consciousness.”

original: bde ba'i dus su dkar po la sogs pa dmigs pa kho na ma yin nam zhes zer ba la thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bde ba'i dus su dkar po la sogs pa dmigs pa kho na ma yin nam zhes zer ba la thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In response to the question, “Isn’t it that at the time of pleasure, for example, only white and so on are observed?,” he says, “The nature of that which is to be attained.”

original: thob par bya ba ni 'jug pa'i yul te dmigs pa yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin te //
analyzed: thob par bya ba ni 'jug pa'i yul te dmigs pa yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin te //
translated: That which is to be attained is the object of engagement, the object, but not the other.

original: thob pa la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no engagement with that which has already been attained.

original: snang ba ni rtogs pa ste thob pa nyid do //
analyzed: snang ba ni rtogs pa ste thob pa nyid do //
translated: Appearance is the realization, the attainment.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni dus mtshungs na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni dus mtshungs na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if they were simultaneous,

original: yang dang yang zhes bya ba ni glang po che'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i shes pa bzung ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang zhes bya ba ni glang po che'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i shes pa bzung ba'i don du'o //
translated: Again and again means in order to apprehend the consciousness of an elephant, etc.

original: ji ltar zhe na thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How? Because of attainment.

original: yul du ma byas pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad la 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: yul du ma byas pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad la 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la /
translated: Since there is no difference in the non-objective, it would apply to all.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the cause and effect of the Sautrantikas.

original: 'bras bu'am rgyu yang mthong nas nges pa ni ma goms pa na rang gi rgyu'i nus pa nyid kyis de ltar nges pa'i rgyu de'i bag chags dang goms pas kyang nges pa kho na byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'am rgyu yang mthong nas nges pa ni ma goms pa na rang gi rgyu'i nus pa nyid kyis de ltar nges pa'i rgyu de'i bag chags dang goms pas kyang nges pa kho na byed pa yin te /
translated: Even when not accustomed to it, certainty from seeing the effect or cause is produced by the cause of certainty itself through the power of its own cause, and by the habit of that cause.

original: shes pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir rang go ngo bo shes pa tsam las thob pa'i shes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir rang go ngo bo shes pa tsam las thob pa'i shes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a consciousness obtained from the mere knowledge of the nature of consciousness itself, because it is a different consciousness.

original: 'jug pa'i don yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i don yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: Because the object of engagement exists, is the view of the Jains.

original: rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa'i rnam pa 'di la med do zhes bya ba yang snga ma dang phyi ma dang de'i tshe yang rig par byed pa po'i rig pa med pa la tha dad pa la sogs pa med par brjod pa yin par bstan
analyzed: rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa'i rnam pa 'di la med do zhes bya ba yang snga ma dang phyi ma dang de'i tshe yang rig par byed pa po'i rig pa med pa la tha dad pa la sogs pa med par brjod pa yin par bstan
translated: The statement “there is no such thing as the aspect of the object of cognition and the aspect of the cognizer” is explained as follows: the cognizer does not exist at the time of the cognition, and there is no difference between the prior and subsequent states.

original: pa ni / yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa ni / yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ Or” indicates another interpretation.🔽The final moment of the object to be attained is the time when the object is cognized. The nature of the object to be attained is not different from the nature of the agent.

original: thob par bya ba'i don byed pa'i mtha'i skad cig ni don byed par rig pa'i dus su gtogs pa'i ngo bo yang byed pa po yod pa yin par khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni dus mnyam pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i don byed pa'i mtha'i skad cig ni don byed par rig pa'i dus su gtogs pa'i ngo bo yang byed pa po yod pa yin par khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni dus mnyam pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ Even if they are simultaneous” indicates this.

original: 'di ltar brjod pa'i mtshungs pa ni sad pa'i shes pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod pa'i mtshungs pa ni sad pa'i shes pa la yang ngo //
translated: The similarity of the statement is also in the case of waking consciousness.

original: rnam par phye ba'i mtshan nyid ni rmi lam dang cig shos tshad ma dang cig shos la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rnam par phye ba'i mtshan nyid ni rmi lam dang cig shos tshad ma dang cig shos la sogs pas so //
translated: The difference in characteristics is due to the difference between valid cognition in dreams and valid cognition in the waking state.

original: de ltar rnam par phye ba yang rig bya ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ci las shes zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par phye ba yang rig bya ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ci las shes zhes zer ba la /
translated: Thus, it is said: “How is it known that the aspects of the imperceptible, etc. are distinguished in this way?”

original: bzung ba dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bzung ba dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, “The apprehended, etc.”

original: bslad pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba ni 'dir grub pa la de rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: bslad pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba ni 'dir grub pa la de rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: “It is only a mistake” means that this is the cause of the establishment.

original: de @134b lta yin dang rmi lam dang cig shos la sogs pa'i gzung ba la sogs pa bde ba kho na yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: de @134b lta yin dang rmi lam dang cig shos la sogs pa'i gzung ba la sogs pa bde ba kho na yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: If that is so, then the apprehended, etc. in dreams and the other world, etc. are only happiness.

original: des na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says,

original: gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa tsam 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi rmi lam dang cig shos la sogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa tsam 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi rmi lam dang cig shos la sogs pa yang yin no //
translated: It is not only the mere conceptualization of the apprehended, etc., but also dreams and the other world, etc.

original: ci las she na rang gi ngo bo tsam zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ci las she na rang gi ngo bo tsam zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: From what? He says, “From the mere intrinsic reality.”

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rmi lam la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rmi lam la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: “Other” means dreams, etc.

original: sngon gyi 'phen pa ni de'i bag chags kyi so //
analyzed: sngon gyi 'phen pa ni de'i bag chags kyi so //
translated: “Previous impetus” means the latent impressions of that.

original: de las ni rnam par rtog pa las so //
analyzed: de las ni rnam par rtog pa las so //
translated: “From that” means from conceptualization.

original: de ltar ni sad pa dang rmi lam la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de ltar ni sad pa dang rmi lam la sogs pas so //
translated: This is so because of waking and dreaming, etc.

original: de ni 'di ltar rang gi sa bon yongs su smin pa las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa las tshad ma la sogs pa nyid phyi rol dang cig shos la sogs pa med kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rang gi sa bon yongs su smin pa las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa las tshad ma la sogs pa nyid phyi rol dang cig shos la sogs pa med kyang ngo //
translated: This is so because of the cognition that arises from the maturation of its own seed, which is valid knowledge, etc., in regard to the external and the other, even though they do not exist.

original: de'i phyir don gyis stong pa'i blo rnams kyi dngos po med pa nyid la tshad ma ma yin pa nyid dang / bsod nams dang sdig pa la sogs pa dang / de'i 'bras bu la sogs pa thams cad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyis stong pa'i blo rnams kyi dngos po med pa nyid la tshad ma ma yin pa nyid dang / bsod nams dang sdig pa la sogs pa dang / de'i 'bras bu la sogs pa thams cad bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is shown that cognitions empty of objects are not valid knowledge in regard to non-existence, and that all merit and demerit, etc., and their effects, etc., are established.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo la rang rig par bya ba dang cig shos nyid du nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo la rang rig par bya ba dang cig shos nyid du nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no experience of such a nature as self-awareness and the other.

original: phyi rol nyid du zhen pas snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang mngon du sems pa tsam gyi byed pa yin par tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid du zhen pas snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang mngon du sems pa tsam gyi byed pa yin par tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it does not appear due to the attachment to externality, and because it is the mere activity of the mind's manifestation, it is not different. This is the meaning.

original: de yang rang gis zhes bya ba ni ngo bor mi rtogs pas gzhan las khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rang gis zhes bya ba ni ngo bor mi rtogs pas gzhan las khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, “by itself” means that it is not realized as an entity, and therefore it is not distinguished from another.

original: de'i phyir rang rig pa las de nyid ces bya ba'i don nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang rig pa las de nyid ces bya ba'i don nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of “that itself” is from self-awareness.

original: de bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is explained: “If . . .”

original: des ma rtogs pa mi gzhan gyis rig pa'i phyir med par mi 'gyur ba zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: des ma rtogs pa mi gzhan gyis rig pa'i phyir med par mi 'gyur ba zhes zer ba la /
translated: Since it is not realized by that, it is not nonexistent because it is realized by another.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: “Another” is stated.

original: des ni gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: des ni gzhan gyis so //
translated: By that, it is another.

original: de las kyang gzhan gyis rig pa yin zhe na gzhan gyis zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de las kyang gzhan gyis rig pa yin zhe na gzhan gyis zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If it is realized by another than that, “another” is stated.

original: spyi'i zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba nyid de /
analyzed: spyi'i zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba nyid de /
translated: “General” is similarity.

original: 'dra ba'i bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: By the nature of similarity.

original: de'i yul rjes su dpag pa ma yin zhing 'dra ba'i yul can du mthong bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i yul rjes su dpag pa ma yin zhing 'dra ba'i yul can du mthong bar bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that its object is not inferred and it is seen to have a similar object:

original: ji spu ldang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji spu ldang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Like the hairs of a cataract.”

original: yul ni lus so //
analyzed: yul ni lus so //
translated: The object is the body.

original: gcig nyid la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas grub pa la'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas grub pa la'o //
translated: “In one” is in what is established by inference.

original: de gnyis las zhes bya ba ni yul tha dad pa nyid las so //
analyzed: de gnyis las zhes bya ba ni yul tha dad pa nyid las so //
translated: “From those two” means from the difference in objects.

original: cis ma yin zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: cis ma yin zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: “How?” means “How is it not so?”

original: 'bras bu tha dad pa las 'dzin byed tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa las 'dzin byed tha dad pa yin la /
translated: The apprehender is different from the difference in effects.

original: des bzung ba bstan pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: des bzung ba bstan pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that it apprehends is taught as follows.

original: spu ldang la sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spu ldang la sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “From the difference in the hairs standing on end, and so on.”

original: ba spu ldang ba la sogs pa @135a * //
analyzed: ba spu ldang ba la sogs pa @135a * //
translated: The hairs standing on end, and so on,

original: tha mi dad pa las bzung ba tha mi dad pa yin na 'dzin byed kyang tha dad par mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /🔽gal te spu ldang la sogs kyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa las bzung ba tha mi dad pa yin na 'dzin byed kyang tha dad par mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni / gal te spu ldang la sogs kyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: are not different from the nondifference in what is apprehended. If the apprehender is also not different, the teaching is as follows.

original: bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du'am /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du'am /
translated: “If the hairs standing on end, and so on, are also like pleasure, and so on.”

original: ba spu ldang ba la sogs pa yang rtags su dbye ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽rang rig pa'i khongs su gtogs pa las kyang ba spu ldang ba la sogs pa ni rang gi bde ba med kyang yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ba spu ldang ba la sogs pa yang rtags su dbye ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽rang rig pa'i khongs su gtogs pa las kyang ba spu ldang ba la sogs pa ni rang gi bde ba med kyang yod pa'i phyir /
translated: The hairs standing on end, and so on, are not different from the nondifference in what is apprehended.🔽The hairs standing on end, and so on, are not different from the nondifference in what is apprehended.🔽The hairs standing on end, and so on, are not different from the nondifference in what is apprehended.🔽The hairs standing on end, and so on, are not different from the nondifference in what is apprehended.🔽The hairs standing on end, and so on, are not different from the nondifference in what is apprehended.🔽The hairs standing on end, and so on, are not different from the nondifference in what is apprehended.🔽The hairs standing on end, and so on, are not different from the nondifference in what is apprehended.🔽The hairs standing on end, and so on, are not different from the nondifference in what is apprehended.🔽The hairs standing on end, and so on, are not different from the nondifference in what is apprehended.🔽The hairs standing on end, and so on, are not different from the nondifference in what is apprehended.🔽The hairs standing on end, and so on, are not different from the nondifference in what is apprehended.🔽The hairs standing on end, and so on, are not different from the nondifference in what is apprehended.🔽The hairs standing on end, and so on, are not different from the nondifference in what is apprehended.🔽The hairs standing on end, and so on, are not different from the nondifference in what is apprehended.🔽The hairs standing on end, and so on, are not different from the nondifference in what is apprehended.🔽The hairs standing on end, and so on, are not different from the nondifference in what is apprehended.🔽The hairs standing on end, and so on, are not different from the nondifference

original: gzhan gyi bde ba'i khyad par rtogs pa bzhin du gzhan gyi rig bya'i khyad par rtogs pa yin par zer ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bde ba'i khyad par rtogs pa bzhin du gzhan gyi rig bya'i khyad par rtogs pa yin par zer ba la /
translated: Just as one realizes the distinction of another’s pleasure, so one realizes the distinction of another’s awareness.

original: gal te kho bo'i zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gal te kho bo'i zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: To this, he says, “If I say . . .

original: gnyi ga dus gcig tu rig bya yin la /
analyzed: gnyi ga dus gcig tu rig bya yin la /
translated: Both are to be known at the same time,

original: dus tha dad pa la ni tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa la ni tha dad pa yin te /
translated: but if they are at different times, they are different.

original: gcig rig pa ma yin yang rig pa yin par zer ba ni /
analyzed: gcig rig pa ma yin yang rig pa yin par zer ba ni /
translated: Even though one is not aware of the other, they are said to be aware.

original: gal te der yang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gal te der yang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: To this, he says, “If you say that . . .

original: dus tha dad pa ma yin pa bzhin du tha dad pa la yang rtags tha mi dad pas tha mi dad pa ni dus tha dad pas bsgribs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa ma yin pa bzhin du tha dad pa la yang rtags tha mi dad pas tha mi dad pa ni dus tha dad pas bsgribs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Just as they are not at different times, so they are not different even if they are different, because the signs are not different. He demonstrates that nondifference is not obscured by their difference:

original: ngo bo nyid kyis dbyer med la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis dbyer med la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “In intrinsic reality, they are inseparable.

original: rtags dang dus dag tha mi dad pa dang tha dad pa dag gis gnyi ga'i bdag gcig yin no zhes zer ba ni /🔽der yang tha dad med pa'ang yin //
analyzed: rtags dang dus dag tha mi dad pa dang tha dad pa dag gis gnyi ga'i bdag gcig yin no zhes zer ba ni / der yang tha dad med pa'ang yin //
translated: ” He says that the sign and the time are not different and that they are different, and that both are the same self.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To this, he says, “There is no difference even there.🔽”

original: gcig gi tshe nyid dus tha mi dad pa nyid yin yang mngon sum nyid yin te /
analyzed: gcig gi tshe nyid dus tha mi dad pa nyid yin yang mngon sum nyid yin te /
translated: Even though the time of the two is not different, it is direct perception,

original: de nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni //
analyzed: de nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni //
translated: because it exists.

original: de ni lkog gyur zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ni lkog gyur zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is called “concealed.”

original: de'i tshe yang gnyi ga rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang gnyi ga rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that at that time, both are known.

original: rtags tha mi dad pa ni snga na yang tha mi dad pa yin na mngon sum dang 'gal bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtags tha mi dad pa ni snga na yang tha mi dad pa yin na mngon sum dang 'gal bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The sign is not different. If it is not different before, it is taught that it contradicts direct perception.

original: rig pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called “knowledge.”

original: lkog tu gyur pa yin zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa yin zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: “Concealed” has been explained.

original: gal te zhes bya ba dang rig pa zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba dang rig pa zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du'o //
translated: “If” and “knowledge” are mutually.

original: gnyi ga cig car snang ba na mngon sum gyi rig bya gcig yin gyi phan tshun spangs pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga cig car snang ba na mngon sum gyi rig bya gcig yin gyi phan tshun spangs pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni /
translated: When both appear simultaneously, it is direct perception. The object of knowledge is one, not mutually excluded, it is said.

original: gal te thung mong bzhin du zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gal te thung mong bzhin du zhes bya ste /
translated: “If, like a common object,” it is said.

original: rtogs nas nges pa la sngon po bzhin du the tshom ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtogs nas nges pa la sngon po bzhin du the tshom ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: After understanding, it is certain. Like blue, it is not doubt, is the meaning.

original: tshad ma gzhan gyis ni tshig la sogs pas so //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyis ni tshig la sogs pas so //
translated: By another valid cognition, by words, etc.

original: rang gi snang ba nyid ni nyan pa po'i'o //
analyzed: rang gi snang ba nyid ni nyan pa po'i'o //
translated: The appearance of the listener is his own.

original: thun mong ba nyid kyi nyan pa po'i tshig la sogs pa'i rtogs pa ni smra ba po yir yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: thun mong ba nyid kyi nyan pa po'i tshig la sogs pa'i rtogs pa ni smra ba po yir yang 'gyur la /
translated: The understanding of the words, etc. of the listener, which is common to both, is also that of the speaker.

original: de bzhin du nyan pa po'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tshig las smra ba po shes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tshig la de las kyang 'di'i yin par zer @135b ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyan pa po'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tshig las smra ba po shes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tshig la de las kyang 'di'i yin par zer @135b ba ni /
translated: In the same way, from the words preceded by the understanding of the listener, from those words preceded by the understanding of the speaker, it is said that they are his.

original: des kyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: des kyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: By that means

original: smra ba pos kyang ngo //
analyzed: smra ba pos kyang ngo //
translated: by the speaker.

original: phan tshun bsten pa yin par bstan pa ni mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun bsten pa yin par bstan pa ni mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The mutual dependence is shown by the words, by perception.

original: mngon sum gyis nges pa la yang tshig la dgos pa med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis nges pa la yang tshig la dgos pa med par bstan pa ni /
translated: Even in the ascertainment by perception, the purpose of words is shown to be nonexistent.🔽By perception means

original: mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: by perception.

original: mngon sum gyis ma rtogs pa la tshig yin par bstan te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ma rtogs pa la tshig yin par bstan te /
translated: In what is not realized by perception, words are shown to be nonexistent.

original: 'di'i tshad ma nyid ni tshig la nges pa'i phyir dang / gzhan du nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: 'di'i tshad ma nyid ni tshig la nges pa'i phyir dang / gzhan du nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: The validity of this is because of the certainty in the word, and because of the non-certainty elsewhere.

original: gzhan yang mngon sum zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon sum zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is called “perception.”

original: rgol ba gzhan la phyi ma dang phyi ma dang phyi ma thams cad du bsdus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgol ba gzhan la phyi ma dang phyi ma dang phyi ma thams cad du bsdus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not included in the other, in the later, in the later and later.

original: re re zhing tshad ma ma yin pa ni bsdoms kyang tshad ma nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni //
analyzed: re re zhing tshad ma ma yin pa ni bsdoms kyang tshad ma nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni //
translated: Each one is not a valid cognition, and even when combined, they are not a valid cognition. This is taught by

original: rab rib can gnyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab rib can gnyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The two with cataracts.”

original: shes pa nyid yin pas zhes bya ba ni rig par bya ba ma yin pa'i sngon po la sogs pa rig par byed pa bzhin du rnam pa gang gi yin de blo yin la /
analyzed: shes pa nyid yin pas zhes bya ba ni rig par bya ba ma yin pa'i sngon po la sogs pa rig par byed pa bzhin du rnam pa gang gi yin de blo yin la /
translated: Because it is a consciousness, just as something like blue, which is not an object of awareness, makes awareness, whatever the aspect is, that is the mind.

original: des yang mngon par sems pa las ma gtogs par blo'i ngo bo rtogs bya dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: des yang mngon par sems pa las ma gtogs par blo'i ngo bo rtogs bya dang bral ba yin no //
translated: And that is free from the object of comprehension, apart from the object of comprehension that is the object of the mind.

original: de kho na ltar ni mngon par sems pa ji lta ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na ltar ni mngon par sems pa ji lta ba'o //
translated: Just like that, it is just as the object of comprehension.

original: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni rig pa gzhan don med pa'i ngo bor byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni rig pa gzhan don med pa'i ngo bor byed pa'i phyir //
translated: “In that” means that the object is made to be the nature of another cognition.

original: don myong ba yod pa ma yin pa ni phyi rol gyi'o //
analyzed: don myong ba yod pa ma yin pa ni phyi rol gyi'o //
translated: The nonexistence of the experience of the object is the external.

original: smras pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: smras pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “What is said” means

original: khyed kyis gzung dang 'dzin pa dag / gcig par 'dod pa 'di min te //🔽de lta'i bdag nyid gcig nyid na //
analyzed: khyed kyis gzung dang 'dzin pa dag / gcig par 'dod pa 'di min te // de lta'i bdag nyid gcig nyid na //
translated: “You do not assert that the object and apprehender are the same,

original: khyod la dpe ni 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: khyod la dpe ni 'ga' yang med //
